column2: depression_finance <- depression %>% group_by(Gender, Financial.Stress, Depression) %>% summarise(count=n())
`summarise()` has grouped output by 'Gender', 'Financial.Stress'. You can override using the `.groups` argument.
ggplot(depression_finance, aes(x = Financial.Stress, y = count, fill = Gender)) +
title = "Financial Stress of Students and Whether or not they are Depressed",
